text:
Hello and welcome to Cupcake Addiction's Monsters
Inc.

Mike Wazowski Cakepop Tutorial where I'll
be showing you how to make this over the top
Mike Wazowski cakepop.

It's actually not as hard as it looks
Tools and equipment that we will be using

for today's tutorial:
I'm resting Mike today just in a polystyrene
block.

I've got some lollipop sticks and some toothpicks
or cocktail sticks.
I've got my pre-rolled cakepop ball.

Now if you don't have a good recipe for getting
your cakepops to this consistency, we've got

one on our channels so I will leave a link
to that in the description box below.

What you'll need to notice is this is about
a regular-sized cakepop ball that I would
normally use.

The one that we're using for Mike today is
a bit bigger.
It's about the size of a golf ball.

So bearing in mind that one of this white
chocolate melts is going to be his eye.
You just want to hold it up.

You can see there, that little one there,
it's way too big to be Mike's eyes.

So you need to make your cakepop ball just
a little bit bigger so it doesn't look out
of place being his eye.

I've got some pale green candy melts or pale
green tinted chocolate.

Now I've used mostly white chocolate with
a few green Wilton candy melts popped in and

a touch of lemon yellow Wilton color paste
just to bring it up to that kind of a little
bit more of a leafy green or a minty almost.
I've got some melted dark chocolate.
I've got some green toffee.
You can also use green fondant for this.
But I'm going to use green toffee.

And I've microwaved that just for about 10
seconds to soften it down so that it's easy
to work with.
A couple of mini-marshmallows.
Some blue M&Ms.
I've cut one of those in half.

Make sure you do this beforehand as you'll
tend to break a few so you'll need to eat
the leftovers.

I've got some white chocolate melts or just
some white candy melts.
A serrated edge knife.
And a smooth-edged knife.
So let's get started.

Now the first thing that we want to do is
we want to make all of our decorations.
So pop your cakepop balls off to the side.

I will also mention with those cakepop balls,
they have been refrigerated for about 15 to
20 minutes.

So this large one here, it's really quite
firm.

You don't want to be able to push it out of
shape particularly easily.
You do want that to be quite nice and firm.

So the first thing that we're going to do
is we're going to take our eye.

This blue M&M is going to be his little Monster
Inc. or Monsters University Hat -- those two
sections.
We've got our little marshmallow there.
So let's start with the marshmallow.

And what we're going to do is we're just going
to cut that in half.
And that's just going to give us our 2 horns.

So what you want to do is sort of just take
a bit of a nick out of the side of it there.
So you don't want it to look like an ear.
You do want it to look like a horn.
So off the side there.
And then...

So you should have a sticky side at the front,

cut the back off.
Beautiful.

So that will give us our 2 nice sort of sharp
looking horns.

Now take another one of those candy melts

And once you've cut it in half, this is going
to be his teeth.

So what you want to do is you kind of want

I'll pull this over so I'm not making too

But you just want to shave out the inside.

Try and do this pretty quickly because your

And you'll see there, I'm just shaving almost

So it shaves quite easily.
It shouldn't be too difficult.

Once again, do have spares just in case you

So just give it a little bit of a time.

So we'll bring that out.
It might have been a touch long.

You can pull out that piece of toffee.

So you've got Mike's eye, his horns, his mouth

Alright, so take your toffee.

And then we're just going to pinch down the

Lovely.
Pinch it, flatten it and pull it.

Alright, so we've done the basics, all of

So you want to make sure that your candy melts

My cakepop ball is nice and firm and we're

there.
Just tilt it from side to side.

Don't be too rough with it because it is quite

So pulling it out of those candy melts, just

Just tap in your wrist, not the actual cakepop

But don't spend too much time on this getting

Alright, now from here, you want it to work

So take your eye, pop it straight on, front

Now you want to take those 2 arms and you

Don't worry if they stick out a little bit,

They will end up hanging by his side as you

You just want to work as quickly as you can

Taking your little hat, you want to pop the

You just want to push it in a little bit further

Taking those horns -- 1 and 2.

Now the last thing that you want to put on

So we'll take the legs.

And if you do find that it's starting to dry

But if you find it starting to dry a little
bit too much, you can just put a little blob.
Pop those green candy melts underneath.

Now I'm actually going to support that leg
because it is still quite wet under there.

As you can see there, I'm supporting it with

other leg.

Now you want to hold those in place just until

because they probably got the least support
out of anything.

So we're just going to hold that for a few

I have tried making him wave and moving his

But with the toffee, it does always seem to
go back to that sort of hanging position.

So as much as it looks cool for about 5 minutes
and you can kind of position it like a little

doll into all sorts of different poses and
directions, it kind of ends up just hanging
loose there.

Alright, so once he's pretty well dry, you
can then just move his little arms and legs
down to, straight beside him.

And there you've got your gorgeous little
Mike Wazowski Monsters Inc or Monsters University
cakepop, ready to go for your little monster.

I really hope that you've enjoyed watching

Don't forget to head over and check out our
